description.raw:
The `hinged_door` model has a `10 N-m` friction (more accurately, stiction) parameter in its handle joint. This effectively means that someone would need to push down with approximately 20 lbs of force on the center of this door handle before the handle even *begins* to rotate.

This is problematic for robots whose fingers may not be able to apply that much force. It's also not a very realistic parameter for a door handle.

This PR removes the stiction parameter and introduces a spring coefficient. Most door handles have a light spring and relatively little stiction (if they're well maintained), so these parameters should be more reflective of a real life scenario.

If we should do any kind of versioning on the model, please let me know.

This is problematic for robots whose fingers may not be able to apply that much force. It's also not a very realistic parameter for a door handle.

This PR removes the stiction parameter and introduces a spring coefficient. Most door handles have a light spring and relatively little stiction (if they're well maintained), so these parameters should be more reflective of a real life scenario.

If we should do any kind of versioning on the model, please let me know.
